page.title: 09FARM LAND USE IN STEWARTON
page.content: This year many farms have not been able to make hay into dry hay bales as the weather has been so wet. Farmers now in September take any opportunity to cut the hay and are making it into big bales covered with black polythene to feed as wet silage in winter. Though well mechanised with varied machinery it has been difficult to go on the land as fields are rutted and muddy this year. There was only one field of barley in the area at Lainshaw Mains. Silage is made in silos, pits or large polythene bags. About half the land is in permanent pasture and most of the remainder is grassland either to be harvested as hay or silage for cattle feed in the winter.
